titles.title: Nuclear Terrorism Jurisdiction Extension and Control Act of 1995
To amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to the extraterritorial jurisdiction of the United States over nuclear terrorism.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 1/30/1995--Introduced. Nuclear Terrorism Jurisdiction Extension and Control Act of 1995 - Revises provisions of the Federal criminal code regarding prohibited transactions involving nuclear materials to make such provisions applicable where one of the persons who committed, or who is charged with committing, the offense is a United States person or the offense is committed against a governmental entity or a United States person (currently, where the defendant is a U.S. national). Defines a "United States person" as a U.S. national or a corporation organized under the laws of the United States, or of any State, district, commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States. Includes within the definition of "nuclear material" byproduct material, source material, or special nuclear material (as defined in the Atomic Energy Act of 1954).
